data-definition.struct-type:
not a real structure, contents declared inline in all known locations
-- If shot by a ranged weapon:

int32_t.name: year
int32_t.comment: time of arrival at site/region_id, not time of death

stl-vector.name: known_secrets
stl-vector.comment: bay12: interation_ptr; Interactions inflicted upon the figure through an I_SOURCE:SECRET means are recorded here; this appears to prevent the interaction from affecting the figure again on subsequent exposure (when rereading a necromancy slab, for example). For interactions with both I_SOURCE:SECRET and another source (I_SOURCE:INGESTION, for example), exposure to the interaction through the non-secret route does not result in the interaction being listed here.

int32_t.name: next_intervention_resistance_year
int32_t.comment: All are gods with the DEATH sphere having created slabs, but the value isn't the id of the slab

stl-vector.name: known_written_contents
stl-vector.comment: bay12: read_written_content_id; ID of written_contents known to the historical figure. Aside from the contents of read books, these so-called written contents also include known derivations of poetic forms, dance forms and musical forms

stl-vector.name: known_identities
stl-vector.comment: bay12: identity_known_id; identity ID of identities known to the historical figure, such as demon true names

stl-vector.name: creature_knowledge
stl-vector.pointer:
bay12: creature_knowledgest
bay12: CREATURE_KNOWLEDGE_FLAG_*
bay12: CREATURE_KNOWLEDGE_SCHOLAR_FLAG_*

struct-type.pointer:
bay12: skill_profilest
bay12: SKILL_PROFILE_FLAG_*
bay12: honor_profilest
bay12: honor_profile_entityst

bay12: interaction_profilest
bay12: divination_profilest
bay12: DIVINATION_PROFILE_FLAG_*
bay12: experiment_profilest

bay12: inventory_profilest
bay12: INVENTORY_PROFILE_FLAG_*
bay12: hf_building_usage_profilest
bay12: hf_building_usagest

bay12: reputation_profilest
bay12: REPUTATION_PROFILE_FLAG_*
bay12: journey_profilest bay12: JourneyType
bay12: JOURNEY_PROFILE_FLAG_*
bay12: journey_milestonest bay12: JourneyMilestoneType

int32_t.name: loyalty
int32_t.comment: 0 - 100. Loyalty, Respect, Fear, and Trust values do not seem to affect the relationship screen description, only Love and Familiarity

int32_t.name: love
int32_t.comment: -100 - 100. Affects relation description: -100: Pure Hate, LE -75: Hated, LE -50: Disliked, LE 49: Acquaintance, LE 74: Friend, LE 99: Close Friend, 100: Kindred Spirit. Lower histfig_id is sorted above higher, except Acquaintance which is sorted on Familiarity

stl-vector.name: counter
stl-vector.comment: One element for each 'attitude' element. Guess 0 - 100

data-definition.struct-type:
bay12: relationship_profile_hf_identityst
bay12: relationship_profile_artifactst
bay12: unknown flags
bay12: intrigue_perspectivest
bay12: intrigue_plotst

artifact id
actor id actor id actor id actor id actor id actor id actor id civ id

bay12: task_delegate_plotst

dtor 0x8C17FA0
(describe-obj $.name) (awhen (find-creature $.race) (fmt "~:(~A ~A~)" $it.caste[$.caste].caste_id $it.creature_id))
bay12: "originator_hfid", yet Toady apparently stores Nemesis IDs here too?

int32_t.name: region
int32_t.comment: assuming actually subregion, not the entire world (which would not have an ID)

class-type.virtual-methods:
once used for 40d HFS
once used for 40d HFS
-- 10
-- 20
"In x, some event happened"
"the happening of some event"
-- 30

int32_t.name: position_id
int32_t.comment: index into entity.positions.own, or an occupation ID

int32_t.name: position_id
int32_t.comment: index into entity.positions.own, or an occupation ID

data-definition.class-type: not actual compound not actual compound

bay12: HISTORY_EVENT_ARTIFACT_CREATED_FLAG_*
not actual compound not actual compound

int32_t.name: stash_site
int32_t.comment: location to which the thief brought the loot

data-definition.class-type: not actual compound not actual compound

int32_t.name: building
int32_t.comment: Guess. the values seen are low numbers. Legends doesn't provide any additional info

int32_t.name: entity
int32_t.comment: the guild to which the figure belongs?

stl-vector.name: defender_role
stl-vector.comment: same as for attacker role, i.e. 0-2, with 1/2 being mercs

stl-vector.name: noncombat_hf
stl-vector.comment: saw being beheaded, but that's only one checked

stl-vector.name: thieves
stl-vector.comment: all of the ones examined were mentioned stealing things during the same raid on the site

static-array.name: event
static-array.comment: not included in the main list

int32_t.name: next_element
int32_t.comment: bay12: number; 1024 for all vectors except the last one

int32_t.name: start_year
int32_t.comment: first year of the events contained in the element

int32_t.name: event
int32_t.comment: bay12: global_id; can be found in the relationship_events

int32_t.name: occasion_type
int32_t.comment: bay12: Circumstance circumstance; only 245/246 seen. 245:scholarly lecture, 246: performance

data-definition.struct-type:
dtor 8532fa0
some value during worldgen, and at the end equals to the number of entities plus that value
11 - necromancers

int32_t.name: event_id
int32_t.comment: NOTE: can be culled. Seen: failed_intrigue_corruption, event_agreement_formed, hfs_formed_intrigue_relationship

pointer.name: corruption
pointer.comment: Mutually exclusive with circumstance. Exactly one is present. Presumably 'bring into network' action doesn't provide membership

enum.name: target_relationship
enum.comment: set if and only if action = BringIntoNetwork

int32_t.name: target_relationship_entity_id
int32_t.comment: Only set when relation = CommonEntity. Common Religion/PerformanceTroupe/MerchantCompany/Guild seen.

int32_t.name: lurer_id
int32_t.comment: Can be set with action = CorruptInPlace, not otherwise
